project_description: A simple Flutter application demonstrating a login flow using the Cubit pattern.
architecture_overview: The project's architecture follows the standard Flutter app structure with a focus on modularity. It uses the Cubit pattern for state management, separating business logic from UI.

methods.name: main
methods.description: Main entry point of the application.

files.name: lib/screens/home/home_screen.dart
files.description: Home screen displayed after successful login.

widgets.name: LoginScreen
widgets.description: A widget that displays the login form.

widgets.name: HomeScreen
widgets.description: A widget that displays the home screen after login.

models.name: User
models.description: Represents a user in the application.

sequence_diagram:
@startuml
actor User
User -> LoginScreen: Enter email and password
LoginScreen -> AuthCubit: login(email, password)
AuthCubit -> AuthState: emit(AuthSuccess)
AuthCubit -> HomeScreen: Navigate to HomeScreen
User -> HomeScreen: Click logout button
HomeScreen -> AuthCubit: logout()
AuthCubit -> AuthState: emit(AuthInitial)
AuthCubit -> LoginScreen: Navigate to LoginScreen
@enduml
state_management_flow: The state is managed using the Cubit pattern. The AuthCubit handles authentication state changes. When a user logs in, the AuthCubit emits an AuthSuccess state, and the app navigates to the HomeScreen. When a user logs out, the AuthCubit emits an AuthInitial state, and the app navigates back to the LoginScreen.
navigation_flow: The app starts at the LoginScreen. Upon successful login, it navigates to the HomeScreen. From the HomeScreen, the user can log out, which will navigate back to the LoginScreen.

pubspec_yaml.description: A simple Flutter app with Cubit state management.
